intro: Pavonia luschnathiana, commonly known as the crimson wood槿, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red bract-like flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Pavonia luschnathiana is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
